panels.description: The chart plots the clusters health, over time. Health is depicted as a integer; 0, 4 or 8 where 0 is OK, 4 is WARN and 8 represents an ERROR state.
panels.title: Overall Ceph Health

alert.message: DIsks Near full detected within the cluster. Warning threshold is 80% full.
alert.name: Disks Near Full

panels.description: This shows how many disks are at or above 80% full. Performance may degrade beyond this threshold on filestore (XFS) backed OSD's.
panels.title: Disks Near Full

panels.description: Count of OSDs currently in a DOWN state
panels.title: OSDs Down

panels.description: This trigger raises a notification if the raw used crosses the 85% capacity threshold of the ceph cluster
panels.title: Cluster Capacity

alert.message: PG peering is a taking a long time to finish
alert.name: PG Peering Delay

panels.description: This chart shows the pg peering state over the last 6 hours. If peering has been ongoing for more than 4hrs, this alert will trigger to prompt further investigation on the ceph cluster
panels.title: PG Peering State

panels.description: This chart shows whether there are pg's in a stuck state, that need manual intervention to resolve.
panels.title: PG's Stuck

alert.message: OSD Host Loss Free Space Check Failed
alert.name: OSD Host Loss Check

panels.description: This graph checks the cluster @ 90% full is enough to support the loss of the largest OSD host
panels.title: OSD Host Loss Check

panels.description: Graph checking for OSD Latencies that are above 1s.
panels.title: Slow OSD responses
